name: The Cliff House Resort & Spa

reviews.text: The piece of property is spectacular, and the view from my balcony is one of the prettiest I've ever had. The staff was fine - pleasant and accommodating enough, although no one went out of their way for us. Three people chose to help one check-in, instead of someone stepping aside to help the person next in line. We made reservations for the Friday evening lobster bake, and it was cancelled without our being notified - we would have made reservations somewhere else, had we known. But I had two big issues, and they were with maintenance - in many many spots, the white railings were full of rust and badly needed a coat of paint, I can't believe management doesn't see this. It cheapens the place considerably. Here I am, swimming in the gorgeous infinity pool, only to look up and see this view that looks like it belongs in the Projects. Also, there was evidence of bugs everywhere, cobwebs on my balcony, dead bugs on windowsills, even the windowsill in the dining area. Not appetizing. These are not difficult to fix issues and it stymies me that it's allowed to continue. On the plus side, the spa is among the best I've ever visited and I recommend it wholeheartedly. But there was vacancy in mid July in this upscale sea resort town, that should tell you something.
reviews.title: Nature Did Her Part, Cliff House Not So Much

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I peeked at prior reviews, many other areas were listed as "more romantic" but i loked the view and the history here so off we went! I have to say it could nto have ben more romantic, staff was great, choc covered strawberries and chesses and cracker options i was able to pre-order were waiting in rom as we arrived, it was a great time. Reviews are good to a degree but then u have to think a bit outside the box. This was a super romantic getaway and it was our 1st weekend away as a couple, could not be happier with the selection!
reviews.title: very nice, very romantic!

reviews.text: I try to go to the Cliff House every year for a few days of rest and relaxation. I cannot imagine a better place to escape; nor a more beautiful one. This is old Maine at its very best. Quiet, serene, and a stunningly beautiful location. The staff is delightful and responsive; the food is outstanding...(I know everyone loves the lobster, as do I , but please try the Blueberry Halibut...it is as good a fish preparation as I have ever had!) I went to the spa every day for massages, a facial, etc. and each was quite good. While not the most modern of hotel accommodations; it is impeccably clean and provides everything you need in a one-of-a-kind location. I'm already planning to go back in the fall.
reviews.title: Wonderful place; breathtaking views

reviews.text: Stayed here twice before but the 3rd time was a mistake. We were put on the 6th floor and were the only guests on the floor. Horrible view of the kitchen fans; no surf to be heard. Hallways, foyer and elevator not air conditioned, curtains falling off of rods, broken blinds, no ice machine. Internet charge of $10 per day is ridiculous. Having paid $317 for one night, I expected more. Spa was phenomenal as was the service. Too bad.
reviews.title: Third Time Was Not the Charm

reviews.text: I recently stayed at The Cliff House for a weekend get away with my besty. I was very pleased with the whole place with one exception, we did not have a fridge in our room. At 295.00 a night I really think all rooms should have a mini fridge. Other than that I have no complaints. The room was nice, the grounds are beautiful and clean, the view breathtaking.
reviews.title: Very nice stay

reviews.text: My husband and I have stayed many many times at the Cliff House and this time we took our grands, ages 4 and 7. Although it really isn't a resort that caters to children, we chose it for the location (short ride to beach and shops) and the indoor and outdoor family pools as well as the convenience of not having to leave the facility for meals. It suited our purpose perfectly. The food was good; the evenings entertainment in the lounge was a treat for all of us, especially the children who love to dance. Being the week after the 4th, it was not crowded. We had a lovely time...the children went home and Grandma stayed an extra two days...enjoying the spa and a little quiet time. A few recommendations I would make are #1. We are repeat customers - upon check-in we (or anyone else in this situation) should be greeted as such "Mr or Mrs Clifford, so nice to have you back with us". #2 Valet service to help with luggage would be a huge plus. #3 Bathroom facilities at the outdoor family pool would be greatly appreciated as well. Overall our experiences have been quite enjoyable and we will continue going back. Love, love the spa. Wouldn't it be wonderful if somehow the ownership would keep the spa and spa building open though the winter months...offer a continental breakfast, a wine bar afternoons and evenings and, of course, spa treatments/packages. One last note - we have always found the service to be very good and the staff more than gracious and accommodating.
reviews.title: A Few Days with the Grands

reviews.text: The Cliff House has a lovely site, perched on the cliffs overlooking the ocean. However, the grounds looked unkept. Also, we were put in the Cliff Top building. It had old and tired decor. There is so much an older establishment can do to update its interior without doing major renovations and this place should make that effort. The bathroom was tiny and outdated. The toilet ran and had to be fixed every few flushes. It was very clean but bags of trash and what I assume was dirty linens sat in the entrance way for over 24hours. At $275 dollars a night I expected more.
reviews.title: Not worth the cost

reviews.text: The location of this hotel is great. It is near everything. The rooms are very basic with no extra amenities. We went to have a spa day and were not disappointed. The spa is really great. The people are very good at what they do.
reviews.title: Great Spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I have stayed at the Cliff House each year for the last six years. This will be the last trip, though. The reason we kept going back was location, location, location. The views and the grounds are beautiful. We enjoy the adults only infinity pool. HOWEVER..... There were never enough lounge chairs at the pool and those they had were broken. I saw at least six in a row with missing slats. The pool towels were so thread bare and I even got one with dried paint on it. Come on. There was a pool bar , but if you wanted service you had to go to them. Only when they were closing did anyone come over to see if we wanted anything.
reviews.title: Last Trip to the Cliff House

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: With room prices around $400 a night this is ridiculous.
reviews.title: Very Disappointing

reviews.text: We, my wife and two children ages 14 & 11, made last minute plans to visit Maine after the 4th of July and were able to get a room at the Cliff House. We had never been there before. I had my reservations with no beach front and the kids, but they had a blast going down to the water on the rocks exploring, looking for different things. The room was perfect, right in the center with a private balcony overlooking the ocean. We all watched an awesome thunder & lightning storm on night. They now include a continental breakfast, and although it is not very elaborate, your seated in the dining room and treated like "royalty." We never felt out of place being there (at a resort/spa) with our children. They were welcome by all. And they did get into some mischief! At night there is always a musician playing in the bar area where you can eat sitting at small tables or oversized leather sofas. We did this with the kids and they loved it. You can drive into town or take a trolly for a dollar within minutes. I can say we will be staying there from here on out! Also, the history of the hotel is fantastic. It's still in the family! Thats probably why they are doing it right. They have my business.
reviews.title: Outstanding views, impeccable service, great food!

reviews.text: If you want to stay on the New England coast, it doesn't get anymore relaxing and scenic than the Cliff House in Ogunquit. The service and staff are impeccably gracious, the views second-to-none, and the hotel's ammenities wonderful. Great piano player in the bar, too!
reviews.title: The Best of New England Shoreline Stays

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After viewing at least five other hotels rooms in person including several reviewed on trip advisor, we determined this to be the best available hotel in this area. The location on the ocean is stunning and we found the staff to be very accommodating and friendly. While not inexpensive, it is much nicer than comparably priced hotels in this area. Some were quite scary for over $300.00 per night. Some were attics converted to hotel rooms and others were just grim.
reviews.title: Very Happy So Far
Great Spa Experience
reviews.text: Back to this hotel, the room is quite large and has a decent sized balcony overlooking the ocean, a small mini bar area with a sink a fridge, coffee maker, etc. The are at least 4 pools, 2 indoor and 2 outdoor. 2 are adult only. The outdoor whirlpool looks great and the fitness center appears to be well equipped.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a wonderful stay. Priced reasonably relative to others. Especially with the million dollar views. Enjoyed our dinner onsite.
reviews.title: romantic getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: VIsitors should know, no kids in the spa pools but there were an indoor and outdoor pools where children are allowed.
reviews.title: Impressive Views and Service

reviews.text: My wife and I received a gift certificate to the Cliff House for Christmas. At first I was very excited to go, but after reading through reviews on TripAdvisor, I became a bit leary. Had it not been for the GC, we probably would have avoided this place, but I'm really glad we experienced it.
reviews.title: Beautiful Place

reviews.text: The view is outstanding as everyone will tell you, but what I also found to be impressive was the service. Everyone from the front desk, to the pool bar, to the dining room, and even the boy washing the walls was very pleasant and looking to assist in any way possible.
reviews.title: Good not great for the price - needs to work on business segment

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The resort could use some renovations, but the entire place isn't outdate. There are some modern areas such as the reception area and spa pool. We had a room on the 1st floor of the Cliffscape. It was the only way to get a full ocean view room with a one-night stay in July. The room was in good shape with the exception of the sliding door to the deck. It was very difficult to open and could only be locked with a board that prevents it from opening. The only real complaint I had is there weren't any room darkening drapes. I woke up at 5:00AM and thought it had to be around 8:00AM because the room was so bright. When I saw the actual time I was stunned. It was surprising that I had no way to darken the room up once the sun crested over the Atlantic.
reviews.title: Oldie but Goodie
